meanings.definition: A room or large cupboard for storing food.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, people kept their food in larders to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: The larders in the kitchen were filled with jars of pickles and preserves.
meanings.sent3: When the cat snuck into the larder, it caused quite a commotion!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a larder of memories, neatly organized and preserved.
meanings.sent5: The larder smelled of spices and herbs, creating a cozy atmosphere in the house.

meanings.sent1: During the winter, the animals relied on their larders of nuts and seeds.
meanings.sent2: The larders of the castle were stocked with provisions for the upcoming feast.
meanings.sent3: The pirates celebrated their latest plunder with a feast from their larders.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a larder of joy, spreading warmth to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The larder of knowledge in the library was a treasure trove for curious minds.
